1989.title: First organized meeting for MAASU
1989.desc: 20 people attended this meeting from 6 schools and one community organization. The schools represented were as followed: Miami University, Michigan State University, Oberlin College, Ohio State University, Purdue University, and the University of Michigan. The community organization was the American Citizens for Justice (ACJ). This was a one-day meeting to discuss whether or not there was a need to start an organization to unite Asian American student organizations in the Midwest.

1990.title: MAASU is incorporated in the state of Ohio
1990.desc: Articles of incorporation are submitted and approved in 1990. Charles Chang is established as the statutory agent.

1990.title: Purdue Asian American Students/MAASU Joint Conference
1990.sub: October | Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN
1990.desc: The first group of officers is formed. At this conference, MAASU held two workshops–one on leadership and the other an informational for the organization. 14 schools attended.

1991.title: Midwest Asian American Conference
1991.sub: March | University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
1991.desc: MAASU held an informational session during which structure and officer positions were discussed. Elections were held and an interim ECC was elected.

1991.title: Spring Conference
1991.sub: April | University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
1991.desc: ECC meets to discuss plans for the upcoming year.

1991.title: ECC Retreat
1991.sub: September | University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
1991.desc: During this retreat, a Constitution is established.

1991.title: Leadership Retreat
1991.sub: October | Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN
1991.desc: During the first-ever Leadership Retreat, the first roll call is completed. 11 schools attended.

1992.title: MAASU granted tax-exempt status
1992.desc: MAASU is granted conditional tax-exempt status. Papers are filed with the IRS in Cincinnati, OH.

1992.title: Spring Conference
1992.sub: April | University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
1992.desc: This is the first conference that MAASU had equal partnership in creating an agenda for the conference. The ECC met with the Asian American Association of UIUC in January to plan for the event. The first election and transition of the ECC and Director occurs.

1992.title: Board of Advisors Meeting
1992.desc: Five board members, the Directors, and the ECC Chair attend the first BOA meeting.

1993.title: Spring Conference
1993.sub: April | The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH
1993.desc: The 2nd generation of ECC is elected.

1993.title: MAASU Leadership Retreat
1993.sub: October 29-31 | Northern Illinois University, DeKalb, IL

1994.sub: April 8-10 | University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
1994.desc: The 3rd generation of ECC is elected.

1995.desc: The 4th generation of ECC is elected.

1995.title: Leadership Retreat
1995.sub: Novermber 17-19 | Notre Dame, South Bend, IN

1996.desc: The 5th generation fo ECC is elected.

1996.title: Leadership Retreat

2016.title: MAASU Alumni Association Created
2016.desc: The MAASU Alumni Association (MAA) started in Fall 2016 to bring together past MAASU conference attendees. MAA’s purpose is to continue building and sustaining relationships between MAASU and its alumni.

2016.title: Leadership Summit - Journey to the Center

2017.title: Spring Conference - #UnitedWeStand
2017.desc: The 26th generation of ECC is elected.

2017.title: Leadership Summit - Timeless
2017.sub: October 27-28 | University of Missouri, Columbia, MO

2018.title: MAASU is incorporated in the state of Illinois
2018.desc: Articles of incorporation are submitted and approved in 2018.

2018.title: MAASU changes its official title
2018.desc: MAASU changes its official name to Midwest Asian Pacific Islander Desi American Students Union for inclusivity. The acronym, MAASU, remains the same, and represents the entire APIDA community.

2018.title: Spring Conference - Overcome
2018.sub: April 23-24 | The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH
2018.desc: The 27th generation of ECC is elected.

2018.title: Leadership Summit - Impact
2018.sub: November 16-17 | Michigan State University, East Lansing, MI

2019.title: MAASU granted federal tax-exempt status
2019.desc: MAASU is granted federal 501c3 tax-exempt status.

2020.title: Fall Conference - Unwritten
2020.sub: October 31 - November 1 | University of Minnesota-Twin Cities, MN
